keywords.indexterm: DITA Map to PDF WYSIWYG Transformation Tracked changes

body.p: The comments and tracked changes can be made visible in the PDF output by setting the show.changes.and.comments transformation parameter to yes.

By default, they are shown as PDF text annotations (sticky notes). These are markers in the document content that are also listed in the Comments section when opening the output file in Acrobat Reader.
To avoid rendering the elements as PDF annotations and show them as footnotes instead, you can use the show.changes.and.comments.as.pdf.sticky.notes transformation parameter set to no.

The comments and changes are included in the merged map either as XML elements: oxy-insert,oxy-delete,oxy-comment,oxy-attributes when using the direct transformation, or, when using the DITA Map PDF - based on HTML5 & CSS transformation, as HTML elements having one of the class oxy-insert, oxy-delete, oxy-comment, oxy-attributes. Sub-elements contain meta-information about each change.
body.note: These elements are automatically recognized and transformed in PDF annotations when using Chemistry as PDF processor.
The inserted text, deleted text, and deleted markup are included in the sticky notes.
